Description: Computational technologies, and their implementation into executable strategies, have permeated all stages of oncology drug discovery. Recent advances in computer hardware and software have increased the speed and scale of computational chemistry, as well as the quality and breadth of impact through increased multidisciplinary integration. This session aims to provide a didactic perspective on evaluating the true potential for the impact of current state-of-the-art computational technologies on oncology discovery programs. This three-part series provides attendees with foundational knowledge of critical elements of the drug development process, such as lead optimization, identification of targets, and drug modalities.
Location: New Orleans Theater A, Convention Center
